name: codex-tools
description: Codex-style shell, apply_patch, and update_plan tools for VS Code language models.

languageModelTools.name: apply_patch
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Apply a file-oriented diff enclosed by `*** Begin Patch` … `*** End Patch`. Each section begins with `*** Add File:`, `*** Update File:` (optionally `*** Move to:`), or `*** Delete File:`. Update sections use `@@` context with lines prefixed by `+`, `-`, or space.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Apply a Codex-formatted patch to workspace files atomically.

patch.description: Full Codex patch text including the envelope markers `*** Begin Patch` and `*** End Patch`.

workdir.description: Absolute or workspace-relative directory used as the patch root. Defaults to the first workspace folder when omitted.

timeout_ms.description: Maximum wall-clock runtime before the patch application is cancelled (milliseconds).

languageModelTools.name: update_plan
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Maintain a short task plan (≤ 8 steps). Provide steps as { step, status: pending | in_progress | completed }. Skip trivial tasks.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Update PLAN.md and sync with the native Copilot Chat TODO tool when available.

plan.description: Array of steps with status (pending | in_progress | completed). Keep it short and focused.

explanation.description: Optional one- or two-sentence context for the plan.

languageModelTools.name: shell
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Execute shell commands in the user's environment. Always set `workdir`. Use narrow, explicit commands. Also supports Codex-style file edits by intercepting `apply_patch <<'PATCH' … PATCH` heredocs in bash/sh/zsh scripts.
languageModelTools.userDescription: Run a shell command from a chosen working directory; output streams to the integrated terminal. Codex-style apply_patch heredocs are applied directly.

command.description: argv vector the model wants to run (e.g. ["bash","-lc","rg -n pattern src"]).

workdir.description: Absolute or workspace-relative directory to run from. Defaults to the first workspace folder when omitted.

timeout_ms.description: Maximum wall-clock runtime before the command is cancelled (milliseconds).

with_escalated_permissions.description: Compatibility field used in Codex prompts. GHCP/VS Code manage approvals natively.

justification.description: Short reason when escalation is requested (≤ 140 chars).

scripts.build: pnpm run check-types && pnpm run lint && tsup
scripts.prevsce:publish: pnpm run check-types && pnpm run lint && pnpm run build
scripts.preovsx:publish: pnpm run prevsce:publish && pnpm run vsce:package
